p: Remdesivir, a nucleotide analog antiviral inhibitor that may compete for RdRp, was designed for the Ebola virus and was with efficient against MERS and SARS [ 80]. Remdesivir has been reported to inhibit in vitro SARS-CoV-2 proliferation and therefore has clinical therapeutic potential [ 81]. Recently, Remdesivir was used in a clinical trial including 53 COVID-19 patients. Results showed clinical improvement in 36 of the 53 patients (68%). However, this drug needs to be used especially for patients not receiving invasive ventilation as the mortality rate was 18% when receiving ventilation, compared to 5% when not receiving [ 82].
